meanings.definition: Able to tolerate a wide range of temperatures.
meanings.sent1: The lizard is eurythermic, meaning it can handle both hot and cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The eurythermic fish can survive in various water temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The eurythermic penguin was equally comfortable in the Arctic and the desert.
meanings.sent4: Her eurythermic nature allowed her to adapt effortlessly to changing climates.
meanings.sent5: The eurythermic plant thrived in any weather condition, from sunny to rainy.

meanings.definition: An organism that can maintain a constant body temperature regardless of external conditions.
meanings.sent1: The eurythermic mammal regulates its body temperature to stay warm in winter and cool in summer.
meanings.sent2: The eurythermic bird can fly at high altitudes without feeling the cold.
meanings.sent3: The eurythermic reptile wore a tiny sweater just for fun, even though it didn't need it.
meanings.sent4: The eurythermic athlete's performance remained steady despite the changing weather.
meanings.sent5: The eurythermic robot adjusted its internal temperature to function optimally in any environment.
